snippet: A $10 billion settlement to resolve claims of foreclosure abuses by major lenders could be announced on Monday, several people with knowledge of the discussions said.
abstract: Group of 14 major banks are widely expected to announce $10 billion settlement to resolve claims of foreclosure abuse following weeks of negotiations with federal regulators; money would be disbursed to borrowers who were foreclosed on in 2009 and 2010, as well as others who are still in danger of losing their homes.
lead_paragraph: A $10 billion settlement to resolve claims of foreclosure abuses by major lenders could be announced on Monday, several people with knowledge of the discussions said.

headline.seo: U.S. and 14 Lenders Said to Be Near Deal of Foreclosure Claims
headline.main: Deal in Foreclosure Case Is Imminent, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Regulators and 14 Banks Are Said to Be Near a Deal on Foreclosure Claims
